intro: Bupleurum multinerve var. longiinvolucratum, commonly known as the long-involucrate bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant features slender stems with opposite, pinnately lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This variant is distinguished by its elongated involucres, which are specialized leaf-like structures surrounding the flower clusters.
